bedded forms[1] are commonly thought of as the most elegant form for a particular group, by which the whole group is expressed in terms of the generators. Thus, a linear group is known to have an E6 subalgebra, as well as an A1, A2, ..., A5 subalgebras. Any other combination leads to a non-trivial group. This form was used for the first example, but there is a generalization of it, the more-familiar Cartan form, that is widely used among physicists. This form shows two vectors. One, the diagonal, is called the "first vector", another one, the "second vector" is the one-dimensional vector (1,0), the generator of the diagonal. As such, x, y, z form the diagonal, with u and v the generators of the orthogonal group. Thus x^2 + xy + y2 + z2 = 1,
x[u] = x,
xy[v] = y,
y[u] = y + vx,
z[u] = z,
x[v] = 0
y[v] = 1,
z[v] = 0,
A subalgebra is one in which all of the generators' products are contained in the subalgebra. To be more general, it is also possible to have several such subalgebras. For example, SU(2) has a E8 subalgebra, and is contained in E7, but is not contained in E6. The non-trivial subalgebras of E7 and E8, E6 and E5 are all contained in SU(2).
Similarly, any group with a subgroup will be in one or more of the above forms. Thus, the linear group E6 has the E8, E7 and E6 subalgebras.
In Cartan normal form
Let the elements of the basis of be such that
[Tj][Tk] = −δjklTl.
Then they are the only generators such that
[Tj,Tk,...,Ti,...,Tr] = σjiλkl...rTl.
By taking
x = Tj, y = Ti, z = Tk
u = Tl, v = 0,
the generators of a linear group are then
u = (Tj,Tk,Tl),
v = Tj,Tk,Tl.
The generators of the diagonal are
X0 = (Tj,Tk,0)
X1 = (0,Tk,Tl)
X2 = (0,0,Tl)
X3 = (Tj,0,0).
The two vectors in X0 define a left-invariant form.
Let the form
σ = σ0+σ10+σ20+σ30
describe the form, so that
σ =1+σ000+σ100+σ200+σ300
These are known as the "embedded" forms. The one that is most commonly used is known as the Cartan form.
Generally, however, such forms are more difficult to use than purely-cron.
The Cartan form is:
Σ = σ+4,
σ_0 = −2,
σ_1 = −1,
σ_2 = 1,
σ_3 = 0
Similarly, the Cartan generators of SOL and SO(3) are given by
X = −2 I
X_1 = −1 X
X_2 = I + X
X_3 = − I.
Here, I is the square of the identity matrix.
Cartan form
Non-isotropic form
A non-isotropic form is the result of applying a non-trivial element to the above vector.
For linear groups, there is no choice but to take one of the non-trivial elements, as they each yield a non-isotropic form. Thus the Cartan generators above yield no other subalgebras than the subgroup containing the diagonal. For others, like SU(2), there exists a non-trivial element that does not break the diagonal into two non-trivial subalgebras.
A non-trivial element is found by using Gell-Mann matrices. These matrices form a group that is isomorphic to a non-cryptic form of symmetry.

instruction: You can write C# code. Given an unsorted array of integers, sort it using quicksort algorithm. For example, if the array is [10, 80, 30, 90, 40, 50, 70], then after sorting it using quicksort, it should be [10, 30, 40, 50, 70, 80, 90]. Quicksort is a divide-and-conquer algorithm that works by choosing a pivot element from the array and partitioning the array into two subarrays such that all elements less than or equal to the pivot are in the left subarray and all elements greater than the pivot are in the right subarray. Then it recursively sorts the left and right subarrays until the array is sorted.

A subsequence is a sequence that can be derived from another sequence by deleting some elements without changing the order of the remaining elements. For example, “ace” and “ae” are subsequences of “abcde” but “aec” and “cba” are not. The longest common subsequence (LCS) between two strings is the longest subsequence that is common to both strings. For example, if the two strings are “ABCDGH” and “AEDFHR”, then the LCS is “ADH” with length 3. Please use Java to solve the above question.

How is a programmer’s brain organized on code writing?
Do you know the structure of a programmer’s brain? When a developer is programming, he/she uses his/her brain in an orderly way. This article is going to reveal you the structure of such programming brain. In the programming process, each developer’s brain work is divided into the following parts. Programmers’ brain is divided into three areas for code learning, writing code, and debugging.
Programmer’s brain is organized with three layers including learning/training, thinking, doing. Learning and training are the first and fundamental layer when programmer’s brain works on programming. In this layer, Programmer absorbs the knowledge, such as concepts and principles of the programming languages.
The programmer’s brain is the thinking layer, which includes many levels of working on complex program ideas while thinking on how to write code. The third layer is Doing which is the programmer’s brain to perform tasks to code with the help of thinking layers. To write code, the programmer’s brain is divided into two main parts like algorithm and data struct.
How the Brain is Organized for Thinking
Although the programming brain is structured in different layers, in terms of software architecture, the brains of programmers are connected in the following ways. The programmer’s brain is a combination of many algorithms which are the same structure of any system or program.
If programmers’ brain is organized as a system or program, then algorithm is the basis of that system or program architecture. The programmers’ brain will be the same for all kinds of programming. In order to write the code, the programmer’s brain breaks down the ideas into algorithm. To understand every algorithm, programmers’ brain takes care of the concept, which is the basis of the algorithm.
Doing as a programming brain structure
While writing code, the programmers’ brain is divided into data structure as following layers.
Programmer’s brain and functions of the layers
Programmer’s brain is responsible for writing the code according to the idea. With idea in programmer’s brain, programmer can break down the idea into algorithm. Algorithm is a basis for data structure which is a fundamental of writing code. While writing the code and debugging, programmers’ brain is divided into the layers.
The data structure programmers’ brain has two major layers which in the second and last layer called the functional programming. However, they both are the different types of programming. Data structures are about the data, which is stored in the structure. Functional programming deals with the idea, function, and algorithm to perform actions rather than manipulating or storing data.
Writing Code Programmer’s brain does not deal with manipulating data although it needs to manage the data.
The following two layers of the data structure programmer’s brain are related to how coding is done and how to write codes. While coding, the programmer’s brain is arranged as layers, which means the coding can be divided into two types named functional programming and data structure programming.
On the other hand, data structure programming is a common type of coding without dealing with manipulating data or storing data; there should maintain, retrieve, modify, and access data. There is a data structure layer where the basic tasks of programming are implemented.
